reviews.review_msg: No very good, disorganized, not very useful, and boring. Anne likes to focus on the most subjective aspects of english while barley prepares you to write for her assignments and finals. Our class did not have a syllabus until like the 3rd week, then it changed multiple times in the following weeks.  also disrespectful to her students.

I loved taking this class with Everton! I don't like English, but he made this class very enjoyable. The content of his lectures was really interesting to me, and his voice was nice to listen to. The only downside is that the TA could really make or break your experience in this course!
Such a great proff!!! Loved all his classes. The work load is nice and easy until right before a paper is due. The TAs are very willing to give guidance for papers.
Dr. Everton provides a lot of opportunities for students to engage with the content.

As a science major, this course was a breath of fresh air. Dr. Everton delivers lectures in such an engaging way that you rarely find yourself bored. This may seem obvious, but you need to be a strong writer to get a good grade. His grading is definitely on the tougher side, but very fair.

Dr. Everton was an amazing lecturer! Although he is a tough grader, he gives awesome feedback on your writing to help you improve. He gave me a whole new perspective on English in general. He didn't allow any technology in class this semester, so beware if you take all your notes electronically. Would highly recommend taking a class with him!

Comes off as simultaneously kind and rude (tough front but a nice guy). Reasonable prof. You have to put in work for the readings but hey, it's an English class. Worst part about him as a prof is that he talks quickly about many different things (hard to keep up with), and lectures aren't recorded. But I liked the course and am glad I took it.

I used to love english, but repeated bad essays & highschool teachers made me hate it. I was super sceptical of the "american lit" stuff but he connected it to history, academic culture, and society to keep it related to everyone no matter your major. Reading and lectures are mandatory obvs, its no harder than any actually good english class

very very unorganized and can not seem to keep a thought going start to finish. clearly knows a lot about his material and likes to act like he is amazing because he is so much smarter then first years in an entry english class.

Jon is awesome, his class was actually very engaging despite his lack of slides and he is hilarious! I would recommend going to class as he does a very good job of explaining the readings if you are confused! Jon's classes are a MUST take at SFU! :)

Incredible prof. easily one of the best English profs at sfu. Actually makes old English inspiring and very interesting. A bit of a Shakespeare geek too so reading any of those plays are very entertaining. Only thing is no laptops or phones in class, which isn't a big deal, but he enforces it sternly.

This guy is amazing. Great lectures, passion, and purpose in the lecture - he's also a great human being. Favourite english course so far. There are books to read, and course is based on them, but they are interesting and well related to the lectures.
